other_tests.findings: The liver is normal in shape and contour with normal echogenicity. No focal hepatic lesions. The main portal vein is patent with normal hepatopetal flow. No intra- or extra-hepatic biliary duct dilation. The common bile duct measures 3 mm. The gallbladder is moderately distended with sludge but no evidence of stones. No gallbladder wall thickening. There is a trace amount of pericholecystic fluid posteriorly and tracking along the hepatic edge. Negative sonographic ___ sign. The imaged portions of the pancreas are unremarkable with the duct within normal limits. Limited views of the right kidney are normal.
